page.title: 13CIVIL SERVICE,EDINBURGH.
page.content: Do you want to adopt a forest or to know where to retire to if you have a chest complaint? Come to the Forestry Commission building in Corstorphine Road. Here in a smoked glass building, opened in 1975,is the HQ of the Commission,where 350 employees formulate policy,administer forests,provide information on holidays,walks and drives. The buiding is shared with the MET.Office.No Bert Fords playing with symbols here but people compiling climatological returns,writing weather reports and providing information on the precise weather details of places in Scotland. So,if you would like a report on the drought of 1976,or a film on the World of Wood,step along to Corstorphine Road.
